result.execSummary:
The defendant Spencer J Chermack was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(>3-10g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)2.
  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $290.60 fine/cost to be paid to Probation while on Probation.
$250.00 DNA surcharge to be paid to Probation while on Probation.

Not to possess or use illegal substances.  
May not vote or hold public office until civil rights are restored.  Other civil rights may be lost until restored.    
If not a U.S. Citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.
May not possess or use firearms or body armor.

CASES: 15CF104 & 15CF106. Defendant Spencer J Chermack in court with attorney Brian Thomas Smestad.  Daniel Patrick Steffen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CW-clerk 11:04 am.  11:43 am recess.  11:57 am back on the record.  

CT finds elig for CIP & SA pgm.  No firearms, cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored, no body armor, if not US citizen face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.

15CF104-
Count 1-I&S 10 yrs, 7 IC & 3 yr ES, probation 4 yrs.  152 days credit.  DNA sample, $250 surcharge.  $290.60. All payable during supervision.  Must report to probation today.  No illegal substances.  Maintain employment.  

Count 8-I&S 1 yr PCJ, subj to GT & WR, probation 2 yrs.  $290.60, DNA sample, $250 surcharge.  Payable thru probation.  FTP-judgment. Must report to probation today.  No illegal substances.  Maintain employment.  
 
15CF106-Count 1- w/h, probation up to 4 yrs concurrent with other.  DNA sample, $250 surcharge, $290.60.  Payable thru probation.  FTP-judgment.  1 yr CT, subj to WR no GT-banked for use by probation.  Must report to probation today.  No illegal substances.  Maintain employment.
